title: Add a UPSC Previous Year Question Papers section to the upscQueen web app

requirements.text: Add a new section on the upscQueen landing page for “UPSC Previous Year Question Papers” that is visible without authentication and fits the existing visual theme.

quotes: Tame old pepar andar nakhi deso UPSC na

acceptanceCriteria: Landing page includes a clearly titled section: “UPSC Previous Year Question Papers”.
All user-facing text in the new section is in English.
The new section follows existing spacing/typography/card styles used elsewhere on the landing page.

requirements.text: In the “UPSC Previous Year Question Papers” section, display a simple, browsable structure (static content is acceptable) that covers at minimum: Prelims (GS Paper I, CSAT) and Mains (Essay, GS I–IV, at least one Optional placeholder).

quotes: Tame old pepar andar nakhi deso UPSC na

acceptanceCriteria: The section shows grouped entries for Prelims and Mains.
Each group contains multiple items (e.g., cards or list rows) with a clear label (e.g., “Prelims GS Paper I”, “CSAT”, “Mains GS I”).

Items have an obvious affordance for future paper access (e.g., a “View / Download” button or link); if no real files/links exist yet, the UI must clearly indicate “Coming soon” (or equivalent) rather than linking to a broken URL.

requirements.text: Add an in-page navigation affordance from the top of the landing page to the “UPSC Previous Year Question Papers” section (e.g., a button/link that scrolls to the section).

quotes: Tame old pepar andar nakhi deso UPSC na

acceptanceCriteria: A user can click a control near the top/hero area and be scrolled/jumped to the “UPSC Previous Year Question Papers” section.
The control label is in English and is understandable (e.g., “Previous Year Papers”).

constraints: Do not edit any files under frontend/src/components/ui or other immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Keep all user-facing text in English.
Do not introduce blue+purple as the primary theme colors (must remain consistent with the existing warm academic palette).
nonGoals: Do not scrape or fetch papers from third-party websites.
Do not require users to log in to view the section.
Do not implement PDF hosting/upload or a full backend-managed papers database in this change unless the user provides paper files/links and explicitly requests backend management.
